body:
> So, could you guys make some retry policies when sw collector start?

As the amount of data increases, es needs more and more times to load data when it starting. So, how long or how much times to retry are hard to setting. I think manual control is the best choose, and most of systems chose this.
The console logging of es told you it’s status when starting. You must waiting for the status changed from RED to GREEN. Then you can start SW collector. 

> Or if it is possible to start sw collector without es's state in green?

No, any systems can not running without dadabase really.

> This is not the responsibility of the collector which processes data from real nodes. The virtual nodes should be generated by the frontend one that has enough information about the trace.

> In conclusion, I prefer to close this issue.

@hanahmily I don't object to close this issue. But I want to make sure the requirement is tracked by the team. Are you saying, you prefer to optimize this in frontend? Even we do this, the graphql query protocol and backend trace query service need to adjust. 

So, could you open one  or two issues to track the requirement?
@dinggel I really think this is a bug or enhancement. I am reopening this issue for track.

@zpf1989 I agree with @peng-yongsheng . If the elastic search is not standby, collector running or not will not be real important. As a storage, please make sure it runs well and healthily.

Try to think in this way, your business system is running with a crash or not standby MySQL.
Have you checked your elastic search status? Look like your elastic search is out of service.
elasticsearch is ok.
maybe you can give me a statement that i can query

OK,thanks for your fast reply.
I get your point,and we will think about some custom process.
Thank you all! @peng-yongsheng @wu-sheng
@zpf1989  Sure. Ping us if you want more helps. I am closing this issue.
I think the ElasticSeach client controls the connections by itself. @peng-yongsheng Do you have, or should have, any mechanism to control connection?

If the connection is not available, you should report a timeout error. This can be restarted by SW to verify.If there is still a problem with reboot, you can consider the ES version. Is the version too high? What I use locally is 5.4.3 without a problem.Restart your service needs your own verification, and look forward to your reply.
Take a look at this issue. [Elastic Search Project Issues 28062](https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/28062)

When you process data in stack, you didn't bother concurrency issue when you use local variables. For cached trace and spans, #AddSpan method has a reentrancelock to protect.

> thanks for scoping this out. main comment is maybe re-use the zipkin main jar as it is less than 200KiB and has no dependencies. This can provide the model and codec operations. Maybe this can help? https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin-junit/src/main/java/zipkin/junit/ZipkinDispatcher.java#L88

@adriancole Done. I am moving on.

> Where is the dequeue coding for the span cache?

I am not using any explicit or manual dequeue. I am using the expired mechanism. See `CaffeineSpanCache#onRemoval`. When we move the in memory buffer to Redis. this mechanism could stay, but only active the in-cache/remove-from-cache by root span, which will make the cluster mode works.

Sure, you first.

we pass the full url when specifying config for clients (in case it is
remapped by a proxy). since this is a server suppose it doesn't matter. for
example zipkin's server doesn't use a url style to indicate the listen
info, rather it allows you only to change the port. how you handle things
here is up to you I think.
if there is no context active, return before `ContextManager.getRuntimeContext()` is ok?

> if there is no context active, return before ContextManager.getRuntimeContext() is ok?

What do you mean about `return before ContextManager.getRuntimeContext() is ok`? I am not following.

> H2 storage implementation is not provided in 5.0.0-alpha, so you must deploy ElasticSearch before try to start backend

See here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/Deploy-backend-in-standalone-mode.md

@ascrutae  My question is, why Spring plugin add a something to runtime context, but there is no active tracing context? Why is this guaranteed by Spring plugin?

If we added these judges everywhere, then what is the point of Runtime context. RuntimeContext should be guaranteed, because it is expected by other plugins.

Closing this, try to use #1284

> Do you have guides/resource to deploy Skywalking on Kubernetes?

In short, there are no any guides to deploy Skywalking with K8S. But I could give some advises that may help you.

## Deploy Zookeeper

In order to deploy Zookeeper in an easy way, you should use a popular Docker image. It's good to have a service for Zookeeper pods that can be accessed by agents and collectors.

## Delpy collector cluster

The key step is to config proper pod network for the collector as @wu-sheng described. The simplest way is to use StatefulSets and HeadlessService.

Then the collectors can access each other by using stable network id which is either Pod hostname or Pod DNS.

The deployment of other components isn't too special to give more details.

Hope these guides make sense to you.
@ascrutae If the hytrix makes more complex than we expected, please consider #1284 as an option. I don't want we deal too much about the across thread

@coder-yqj Thanks for fixing this.

Solution: Block the workers which cache collection's size exceed the setting.

Add a configuration item: 
```
configuration:
  default:
      workerCacheMaxSize: 10000
```

@wu-sheng Are there some advise for my solution?
@peng-yongsheng My suggestion, you should be care of the gRPC buffer too. And do you confirm you want to do this in beta2?
It's be done, testing.
gRPC will blocked cause by the workers blocked which gRPC invoked.

> gRPC will blocked cause by the workers blocked which gRPC invoked.

Agent has a time out mechanism. If you are going to block at server side, we need to review the mechanism again. The server side safe may trigger agent out of memory. That will be a bigger issue/concern for end users.

I am not familiar with Eclipse env. Always in IntelliJ. We already provided document about how to build our source codes in command line, and only provided that, because that stays unchangeable. 

https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/How-to-build.md
And if you are not familiar with all SkyWalking project structure, I don't recommend you to start from run in IDE. We provide binary distribution, please consider to use that.

Connection URL Syntax:
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/connector-j/8.0/en/connector-j-reference-jdbc-url-format.html

database
The default database or catalog to open. If the database is not specified, the connection is made with no default database.
tiny-rpc-3.4.7=com.hsjry.monitor.sw.client.agent.define.TinyRPCInstrumentation

Add notice from @ascrutae feedback:

> Look like you added byte-buddy.jar into the plugin.

I have said before, please package your extra plugin codes without dependency. The classloader issue is the core problem solved by agent core. So, you must follow all rules. When you do something the doc doesn't mention, you should be very careful. Some errors in here are unexpected by most of the community people, and will be hard to find out why.

I think we need your demo application to see what is happening. SkyWalking is used in many companies and projects widely. It is hard to assume this is bug from our release ways.

I have following questions?
1. Do you download our release from apache.skywalking.org ?
1. Do you try to write some plugins?
1. Are you using some middleware, which is not in our supported list?
At the same time, you package folder is not as I expected. `E:\agent\skywalking-agent.jar`. This is my expected official release, the red mark is agent related.

So, you didn't set the database in your connection URL. Right?

If so, @ascrutae I think you should consider this as a special case.  By the MySQL Connector official doc, it is allowed and legal.
